questions.question:
What is the output of the following code snippet?

enum Months {JAN = 1, FEB, MAR, APR};

int main() {
 enum Months month = APR;
 printf("%d", month);

 return 0;
}

Consider the following structure definition:

struct Rectangle {
 int length;
 int width;
 };

How much memory will an instance of this structure occupy on a typical 32-bit system?

What does the following code snippet do?

union Data {
 int i;
 float f;
 char str[20];
 };

int main() {
 union Data data;

 data.i = 10;
 printf("%d, %f", data.i, data.f);

 return 0;
}

What is the output of the following code snippet?

int main() {
 int x = 5;
 int *ptr = &x;

 (*ptr)++;

 printf("%d", x);

 return 0;
}

Given the array declaration 
int arr[5] = {1, 2, 3, 4, 5};
, what is the value of arr[3]?

What is the output of the following code snippet?

int main() {
 char str[] = "C Programming";
 int len = sizeof(str) / sizeof(str[0]);

 printf("%d", len);

 return 0;
}

What will be the value of x after executing the following code snippet?

int main() {
 int x = 10;
 int *ptr = &x;

 (*ptr)--;

 printf("%d", x);

 return 0;
}

What is the output of the following code snippet?

int main() {
 char str[] = "Hello, World!";
 int count = 0;

 while (str[count] != '\0') {
 count++;
 }

 printf("%d", count);

 return 0;
}

Given the following enum declaration:

enum Days {SUNDAY, MONDAY, TUESDAY = 5, WEDNESDAY};

What is the value of TUESDAY?

What is the output of the following code snippet?

int main() {
 int arr[] = {1, 2, 3, 4, 5};
 int *ptr = &arr[3];

 printf("%d", (*ptr)--);

 return 0;
}

What is the output of the following code snippet?

int main() {
 int x = 10;
 int *ptr = &x;

 (*ptr)++;
 ptr = NULL;

 (*ptr)++;

 printf("%d", x);

 return 0;
}

What is the output of the following code snippet?

int main() {
 int x = 5;
 int *p = &x;

 printf("%d", ++(*p));

 return 0;
}

What is the output of the following code snippet?

int main() {
 char str1[] = "Hello";
 char str2[] = "World";

 strcat(str1, str2);

 printf("%s", str1);

 return 0;
}
What is the purpose of the volatile keyword in C?

options.B: To declare a variable as global
options.C: To indicate that a variable may be changed by external factors
options.D: To specify the return type of a function

questions.question:
What is the output of the following code snippet?

int main() {
 int arr[] = {1, 2, 3, 4, 5};
 int *ptr = &arr[0];

 printf("%d", *ptr++);

 return 0;
}

What is the output of the following code snippet?

int main() {
 int x = 5;
 int *p = &x;

 printf("%d", (*p)--);

 return 0;
}

Given the union definition:

union Data {
 int i;
 float f;
 char str[20];
 };

What is the size of the union on a typical 32-bit system?

What is the output of the following code snippet?

int main() {
 int x = 5;
 int *p = &x;

 printf("%p", p + 1);

 return 0;
}

options.A: The address of x incremented by 1

questions.question:
What is the output of the following code snippet?

int main() {
 int x = 10;
 int *ptr = &x;

 (*ptr)++;
 printf("%d", x);

 return 0;
}

What is the output of the following code snippet?

int main() {
 int x = 5;
 int *p = &x;

 printf("%d", ++(*p));

 return 0;
}
